N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 84.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

For purposes of this Part: (a) The term mortgage loan shall mean any
loan made on the security of residential, nonresidential, improved or
unimproved real estate where the lender relies upon such real estate as
security for the loan, including a loan secured by a lien on an existing
ownership interest in certificates of stock or other evidence of an ownership
interest in, and for a proprietary lease from, a corporation or partnership
formed for the purpose of the cooperative ownership of real estate. The term
mortgage loan shall not include any loan not considered to be a loan upon the
security of real estate within the meaning of section
103
(4)(b)
of the Banking Law. (b) The term lender shall mean a bank, trust
company, savings bank or savings and loan association organized under the
provisions of the Banking Law. Notes
